Description: Tondo sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lip- or band-cup with scar of stem; interior: black border around tondo: alternating red and black tongues (with faded added white dots at top of dividing line) between sets of four lines; in tondo, black figure Gorgoneion (alternating locks of hair in red and black, red on eyes with black circle around pupil, red tongue, faded white teeth, incised flecks on moustache and dilute brown wrinkles on forehead); exterior glazed.
Producer name: Attributed to: The Painter of the Palermo Gorgoneion
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.42)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 270, no. 56)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 421, no. B661)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 234, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0584) (Phase 1)
